update sys_role
role_name = #{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
role_code = #{roleCode,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
role_type = #{roleType,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
app_id = #{appId,jdbcType=BIGINT},
validate_state = #{validateState,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
version = #{version,jdbcType=BIGINT},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where ID = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}

update sys_role set
role_name = #{roleName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
validate_state = #{validateState,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
update_time = now(), update_user = #{updateUser} where ID = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
mapper.select: select t1.id , t1.role_name , t1.role_code , t1.role_type , t1.app_id , t1.validate_state , t1.version from sys_role t1, sys_role_user t2,sys_user t3 where t1.id = t2.role_id and t1.validate_state='1' and t2.target_id = t3.id and t3.user_no = #{userNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
select id,role_name,role_code from sys_role where validate_state = 1 and role_code !='admin'
